intro: Psychotria vaupesana, commonly known as the Amazonian psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish-white flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria vaupesana is also known for its potential ethnobotanical uses among indigenous communities.
